definition: to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: You'll be pleased to know I'm prepared, for whatever you have to offer.
sentences.chinese: 你一定很高興，因爲我的回禮準備很周到哦。

sentences.english: So, if Bush's condolences never come, he'll have nobody to blame but himself.
sentences.chinese: 所以，如果等不來布什總統的回禮，也不能怪罪人家。

sentences.english: He sent me a return present.
Perhaps the public is simply returning the favour.
sentences.chinese: 或許，公衆也只是“回禮”罷了。

sentences.english: As I crossed, I waved to the courteous drivers in gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 當我穿越時，我向尊敬的司機們揮手回禮。

sentences.english: My wife always checks our wedding registry and gives the same as was given us.
sentences.chinese: 我妻子經常翻看婚禮註冊賬，然後等額回禮。

definition: paper doll/papercut silhouette
full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
masquerade
honorarium/gift as thanks
to take a wife
Christmas card
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
to settle an account
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
double happiness cakes, pastries offered by a man to his fiancée's family at the time of their engagement
shady relationship/affair/adulterous relationship
ability/skill
invitation card/written invitation
